DOC.brief_summary: It is the primary purpose of this pilot study to investigate if physical therapy with strength training is better at improving muscle and gait function after anti-spastic treatment with Botulinum toxin compared to physical therapy without strength training in children with cerebral palsy. The investigators hypothesize that it is.
DOC.brief_title: Physical Therapy After Anti-spastic Treatment in Children With Cerebral Palsy
DOC.criteria: cerebral palsy (diplegia and hemiplegia) indication for antispastic treatment with Botulinum toxin fixed contractures
